name: BPC-157
description: Promotes healing of muscles, tendons, and ligaments. Research use only.
detailedDescription: BPC-157 is a synthetic peptide that promotes healing and regeneration of various tissues including muscles, tendons, and ligaments. It has been shown to accelerate the healing of wounds and injuries in research studies.
dosingLogic: Standard research dose is 250mcg per day. Dosage may vary based on research protocol and body weight.

name: TB-500
description: Supports tissue regeneration and reduces inflammation. Research use only.
detailedDescription: TB-500 is a synthetic version of thymosin beta-4, a naturally occurring peptide that promotes tissue regeneration and reduces inflammation. It has been studied for its potential in wound healing and tissue repair.
dosingLogic: Research dose typically ranges from 2-5mg per week, divided into 2-3 administrations.

name: GHK-Cu
description: Copper peptide that promotes collagen synthesis and skin regeneration. Research use only.
detailedDescription: GHK-Cu is a copper-binding peptide that stimulates collagen and elastin production, promoting skin regeneration and wound healing. It has antioxidant properties and may help reduce signs of aging.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 1-2mg per day, applied topically or administered subcutaneously.

name: Epithalon
description: Telomerase activator that may extend cellular lifespan. Research use only.
detailedDescription: Epithalon is a synthetic peptide that activates telomerase, potentially extending cellular lifespan and promoting tissue regeneration. It has been studied for its anti-aging properties.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 100-200mcg per day for 10-20 days, followed by a break.

name: Semax
description: Nootropic peptide that enhances cognitive function and memory. Research use only.
detailedDescription: Semax is a synthetic peptide that enhances cognitive function, memory, and learning capacity. It has neuroprotective properties and may improve focus and mental clarity.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 600-800mcg per day, administered intranasally or subcutaneously.

name: Selank
description: Anxiolytic peptide that reduces stress and improves cognitive performance. Research use only.
detailedDescription: Selank is a synthetic peptide with anxiolytic and nootropic properties. It reduces stress and anxiety while improving cognitive performance and memory.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 300-500mcg per day, administered intranasally or subcutaneously.

name: RAD-140
description: Selective androgen receptor modulator for muscle building. Research use only.
detailedDescription: RAD-140 is a selective androgen receptor modulator (SARM) that promotes muscle growth and strength without the side effects of traditional anabolic steroids. It has high tissue selectivity.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 10-20mg per day for 8-12 weeks, followed by a break.

name: LGD-4033
description: SARM that promotes lean muscle mass and strength gains. Research use only.
detailedDescription: LGD-4033 is a selective androgen receptor modulator that promotes lean muscle mass and strength gains. It has been studied for its potential in treating muscle wasting conditions.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 10-15mg per day for 8-12 weeks, followed by a break.

name: AOD-9604
description: Fat-burning peptide derived from human growth hormone. Research use only.
detailedDescription: AOD-9604 is a modified fragment of human growth hormone that promotes fat burning without the side effects of full HGH. It specifically targets fat cells and may help with weight loss.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 300-500mcg per day, administered subcutaneously.

name: DSIP
description: Delta sleep-inducing peptide that promotes natural sleep. Research use only.
detailedDescription: DSIP (Delta Sleep-Inducing Peptide) promotes natural sleep by increasing delta wave activity in the brain. It may help improve sleep quality and duration.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 100-200mcg per day, administered before bedtime.

name: Melanotan II
description: Synthetic peptide that stimulates melanin production and may affect sleep. Research use only.
detailedDescription: Melanotan II is a synthetic peptide that stimulates melanin production, leading to skin darkening. It also has effects on appetite and may influence sleep patterns.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 1-2mg per day for tanning effects, with lower doses for sleep modulation.

name: Ipamorelin
description: Growth hormone secretagogue that promotes natural GH release. Research use only.
detailedDescription: Ipamorelin is a growth hormone secretagogue that stimulates the natural release of growth hormone from the pituitary gland. It may help with recovery, muscle growth, and anti-aging effects.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 200-300mcg per day, administered subcutaneously.

name: CJC-1295
description: Long-acting growth hormone releasing hormone analog. Research use only.
detailedDescription: CJC-1295 is a long-acting analog of growth hormone releasing hormone that stimulates the natural production of growth hormone. It has a longer half-life than other GHRH analogs.
dosingLogic: Research dose is typically 1-2mg per day, administered subcutaneously.
